body:
This patch is based on #21594, which needs to be merged first.

While looking at issue #21351, it turned out that the issue was a lack of tor v3 addresses known to the node. It became clear (e.g. https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/21351#issuecomment-811004779) that a CLI command returning the number of known addresses per network would be very helpful. This patch adds that.

```
$ bitcoin-cli --help | grep -A1 addressinfo
  -addressinfo
       Get the number of addresses known to the node, per network and total.

$ bitcoin-cli -addressinfo
{
  "addresses known": {
    "ipv4": 185,
    "ipv6": 0,
    "torv2": 5572,
    "torv3": 2216,
    "i2p": 7,
    "total": 7980
  }
}

$ bitcoin-cli -addressinfo 1
error: -addressinfo takes no arguments
```

This can be manually tested, for example, like this:
```
$ bitcoin-cli getnodeaddresses 0 | jq '.[] | (select(.address | contains(".onion")) | select(.address | length <= 22)) | .address' | wc -l
5572
$ bitcoin-cli getnodeaddresses 0 | jq '.[] | (select(.address | contains(".onion")) | select(.address | length > 22)) | .address' | wc -l
2216
$ bitcoin-cli getnodeaddresses 0 | jq '.[] | .address' | wc -l
7980
```
title: cli: create -addressinfo
